page.title: 10Parsonage Farm, Henham
page.content: One of the farms in Henham is Parsonage Farm and is owned by Mr.J. Pimblett who has owned it for 52 years Mr.J.Pimblett wanted to own a Farm because it had run in his family. 3 or 4 people work on his farm .The crops which are grown are Wheat,Barley and Oats .The best is wheat and 350 acres of it are grown The farm has 540 acres in all The machinery kept on the farm is 9 Tractors,8 ploughs 1 Combine Harvester worth Â£38,000. The stubble is burnt after harvesting so that you can carry on sowing the crops .It would be very difficult if the stubble is not burnt.Stubble burning annoys many people.The most interesting thing about owning the farm was the harvestig and the least interesting thing is sitting in the office.The busiest times of the year are September and August.
